Post_Title: Sony's voice chat policy is more than welcome. Hate speech has no place in 2020.
post_text: As a black gamer who grew up from Nintendo to now (40 years old) you guys aren't aware how many times I've been called aggressive racial slurs from 14 year old kids. I just thought it was a fact of life... I applaud Sony for helping remove hate speach. It isn't rare that this happens to us. I appreciate what they are doing

Threads.Reply_Text: If someone goes on a racist rant in voice chat why shouldn't they be banned? "Oh but its freedom of speech" stfu. If you're not spewing racism and hate in your voice chats you're fine. Ive been on the receiving end of it plenty of times and I'm glad they're doing this.

Replies.Reply_Text: Freedom of speech also doesn't apply to platforms and services. Companies can make rules about speech on their platforms. Anyone claiming "freedom of speech" doesn't even understand what that really means.
